hexes.description: Hot springs bubble from cracks in the arid earth. Steam rises from carved pools at different elevations.
Fish break the surface near the reef. The Shallows teem with colorful marine life.
Reef formations create a natural harbor. Fishing boats bob at anchor.
Warm currents from underwater vents create misty patches on the surface.
The water carries an oily sheen near the corrupted eastern coastline.
The water grows deeper. Currents from the open ocean swirl against the reef.
Warm coastal waters lap against golden beaches.
Steep streets of an ancient First Age city climb the hillside. Vending machines and trolley cars everywhere.
Gentle waves carry the scent of salt and flowers from the nearby coast.
Uncommonly tall grass stretches endlessly, swaying in constant wind. Hidden paths through the Gale Fields.
A half-sunken First Age vessel rests in the shallows, claimed by coral.
A settlement built into the mountainside where legendary smiths forge rare alloys in volcanic heat.
Steam rises from a ramshackle building. The legendary scent of Hakumon's ramen draws travelers.
A plateau of craggy rock with dramatic ocean cliffs. An observatory perches at the highest point.
Wind-swept grassland. Ancient nakudama road stones mark a forgotten highway.
Deep within the Gale Fields, fish-head effigies mark the Fish Head Coven's domain.

feature.name: Road Camp
feature.description: A crude shelter offers protection from the elements.

hexes.description: Mount Arbora's snow-capped peak looms overhead. Meltwater cascades down rocky channels.
A lighthouse perches on a rocky spit. Partially built structures crumble, reclaimed by colorful crabs.
An abandoned fish market overlays a bustling spirit bazaar. Spirit fish drift between realms.
Colorful sand structures rise from the beach, rebuilt by master sculptors. The Tower of Glass glints.
Calm waters along the Gift of Shuritashi's southern coast.
The southern coast stretches toward open ocean.
The tall grass of the Gale Fields thins near the coast. A courier brigade fort guards a crossroads.
A massive bird's nest of woven branches and First Age debris between two peaks. Something enormous lives here.
A village on stilts above murky wetlands. Wooden boardwalks connect homes and shops.
Black ooze seeps from the ground. Plants are twisted and discolored. The Corruption has taken hold.
Corrupted water laps at twisted coral. Fish folk patrol these waters.
Open ocean. Fishermen say the currents pull you east.
The vast ocean. No one who sails beyond the horizon returns.

feature.name: War's End
feature.description: Crows still pick at remnants of the fallen.

hexes.description: Deep water beyond the reef. Mariners' Guild buoys mark safe passage.
Stilted walkways connect ramshackle buildings over brackish water. The smell of mud eels.
Dark waters mark the domain of the Lionfish King. Fish folk patrols lurk beneath.
The trees here move when you're not looking. Vines creep and branches shift—the Crawling Canopy.
Stone steps carved into the mountainside lead upward through thin air and alpine meadows.
Giant mushrooms tower above the forest canopy. The air smells of rich earth and mycelium.
Lake Ellior stretches before you, its dark waters hiding the submerged tiers of an ancient ziggurat.

questObject.name: Bound Tome
questObject.description: Cold to the touch, despite the ambient temperature.

hexes.description: Rolling hills of farmland. Sheep dragons graze among rusted-out First Age vehicles.

npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of traveling beyond Obojima

npcs.name: Nalli
npcs.description: Dock hand who manages the small flotilla of punts and coracles
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Massive arms from years of poling boats
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to prove their worth to a mentor

npcs.name: Reen
npcs.description: Quiet trapper who sets snares for marsh hares and monitors wildlife
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A live frog always sitting on her shoulder
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Broad Naldo
npcs.description: Massive farmer who tends Okiri's terraced rice paddies. His booming voice carries across the valley.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Arms like tree trunks, always carrying a hoe
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks the perfect mushroom specimen

npcs.name: Miss Lindley
npcs.description: Eccentric artisan and hedge witch who crafts talismans from mountain flowers. Knows more than she lets on about the old magic.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Fingers permanently stained purple from herb work
npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of opening their own shop

npcs.name: Wenneth
npcs.description: Sword champion of Okiri who won the annual blade tournament three years running. Trains anyone willing to learn.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A thin scar running from temple to jaw
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to find a lost family heirloom

npcs.name: Morna
npcs.description: A child who plays among the fields but listens to everything. Reports to Zolde in Polewater via messenger birds.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Oversized hat that hides her face
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a rare ingredient for a special recipe

npcs.name: Thim Torrelli
npcs.description: Gentle shepherd who grazes his flock on the high meadows above Okiri. Twin brother to Torrio.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Plays a wooden flute beautifully
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Torrio Torrelli
npcs.description: Shepherd and twin to Thim. More hot-headed than his brother, fiercely protective of the village flocks.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Identical to Thim except for a broken nose
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks spiritual enlightenment

npcs.name: Rokoko
npcs.description: A jewel beetle spirit who runs Matango's finest kitchen. Rokoko's dishes use rare fungi and are legendary across Obojima.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Carapace that shimmers between emerald and copper
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to protect someone dear to them

npcs.name: Madame Porcini
npcs.description: Proprietor of the Spore & Slumber inn. Madame Porcini knows every rumor that passes through Matango's fungal groves.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Mushroom-shaped hat that she never removes
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to learn ancient First Age secrets

npcs.name: Reheni
npcs.description: Self-proclaimed 'Truffle Prince' of Matango. Reheni has an uncanny nose for the rarest underground fungi.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Always dusted in spores
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to befriend a spirit

npcs.name: Chogo
npcs.description: Leader of a small gang that controls the black-market mushroom trade. Charming but ruthless when crossed.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Gold-capped tooth shaped like a mushroom
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a rare ingredient for a special recipe

npcs.name: Marvolio Chanterelle
npcs.description: Flamboyant fashionista who designs clothing from bioluminescent fungal fibers. His creations glow in the dark.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Clothes that softly glow in shifting colors
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to prove their worth to a mentor

npcs.name: Mama Amala
npcs.description: Retired monk who settled in Matango to study the spiritual properties of the great mycelium network.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Prayer beads made of petrified fungal caps
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks spiritual enlightenment

npcs.name: Myron
npcs.description: Druid who tends the fungal groves and maintains the delicate balance between the mushroom colonies and the forest.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Bark-like skin patches on his hands
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to prove their worth to a mentor

npcs.name: Bree
npcs.description: Tiny merchant spirit who sells curios and oddities from a stall made of giant shelf fungi.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Translucent wings that buzz when excited
npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of opening their own shop

npcs.name: Master of Ceremonies
npcs.description: The enigmatic host of Uluwa's floating spirit market. Nobody knows his true name. He orchestrates the nightly gatherings with theatrical flair.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A mask that changes expression on its own
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to protect someone dear to them

npcs.name: Humble Utzu
npcs.description: Supposedly humble spirit who runs a 'legitimate' trading post. Actually the island's most prolific smuggler of First Age artifacts.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Eyes that glow faintly in the dark
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to settle an old score

npcs.name: Emille
npcs.description: Wandering busker who plays haunting melodies on a bone flute. His music can calm spirits and agitate the living.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Antlers adorned with tiny bells
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks the perfect mushroom specimen

npcs.name: Throth
npcs.description: Self-appointed constable of Uluwa who keeps order among the spirits. Stern but fair, and secretly lonely.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A badge made from a polished river stone
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Orble the Fisher
npcs.description: Ancient spirit fishmonger who catches spirit fish with his bare hands from the luminescent pools beneath Uluwa.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Hands that shimmer like fish scales
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a rare ingredient for a special recipe

npcs.name: Dapo
npcs.description: Master of fermented fish paste, a delicacy among spirits. His recipes are generations old and fiercely guarded.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Perpetual smell of fermented fish that spirits find intoxicating
npcs.flavorWant: Wants revenge on someone who wronged them

npcs.name: Master Hu
npcs.description: Legendary baker whose Happy Joy Cakes are famous across Obojima. His bakery is a Yatamon landmark.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Flour permanently dusted in his eyebrows
npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of opening their own shop

npcs.name: Cholly
npcs.description: Conductor of Yatamon's rickety trolley system. Cholly knows every street and shortcut in the city.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A conductor's cap that floats slightly above his head
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to build something lasting

npcs.name: Himitsu
npcs.description: Keeper of the Whispering Lantern tavern, where secrets are the preferred currency. Himitsu collects rumors like others collect coins.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Lantern eyes that dim when they're listening intently
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Jenni
npcs.description: Cheerful shopkeeper who runs the general store. Jenni stocks everything from rope to rare tea blends.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Apron with impossibly many pockets
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to master a new craft

npcs.name: PM Escalante
npcs.description: Yatamon's meticulous postmaster who oversees the Courier Brigade's city operations. Nothing enters or leaves without her knowledge.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Ink-stained fingers and reading spectacles
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks spiritual enlightenment

npcs.name: Gomber
npcs.description: Private detective who works the back alleys of Yatamon. Gruff, cynical, but has a soft spot for lost causes.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A battered fedora and a magnifying glass on a chain
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to build something lasting

npcs.name: Granny Yuzu
npcs.description: Eccentric collector of First Age artifacts. Her cramped shop is a treasure trove of ancient oddities.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Spectacles with multiple rotating lenses
npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of traveling beyond Obojima

npcs.name: Tatsu
npcs.description: Leader of the Jade Fang gang. Controls the dockside district through intimidation and a network of informants.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Jade-green tattoo of a serpent coiling up his neck
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Mikiko
npcs.description: Young apprentice witch studying under an absent master. Eager but prone to magical mishaps.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Hair that changes color with her mood
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a cure for an ailment

npcs.name: Dr. Zalia Frond
npcs.description: Brilliant scholar researching the Corruption's origin. She believes it's connected to First Age technology buried beneath the island.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Always carries a leather journal filled with diagrams
npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of traveling beyond Obojima

npcs.name: Krocius
npcs.description: Historian and linguist who can read First Age inscriptions. Quiet and methodical, he works closely with Dr. Frond.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Spectacles with one cracked lens he refuses to replace
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to reunite with a lost companion

npcs.name: Lula
npcs.description: Proprietor of the Moonpetal Lounge, a rival tavern to the Whispering Lantern. Lula serves drinks that induce visions.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Petals that fall from her hair and dissolve before hitting the ground
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to reunite with a lost companion

npcs.name: Imelda
npcs.description: Elegant thief who specializes in liberating art from undeserving owners. Maintains a refined public persona.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Elven ears half-hidden by an elaborate hairstyle
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to befriend a spirit

npcs.name: Mr. Basingstoke
npcs.description: Respectable-seeming warlock who runs an antiquities shop as a front. His patron is unknown but clearly powerful.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: One eye that is solid black
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Mortimus Fids
npcs.description: Curator of the Yatamon Museum of Natural Curiosities. Obsessed with cataloging every species on Obojima.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Monocle and a butterfly net he always carries
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to find a lost family heirloom

npcs.name: Bokka Bokka
npcs.description: Enthusiastic spirit street performer who juggles balls of light. Knows everyone in the market district.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Luminous orbs orbiting his head
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to settle an old score

npcs.name: Gojo
npcs.description: Rival ramen chef to Hakumon in Polewater. Gojo's noodle cart in Yatamon draws huge crowds.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Headband soaked in broth
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to prove their worth to a mentor

npcs.name: Kenta
npcs.description: Beachcomber who scours the Yatamon waterfront for washed-up treasures and First Age debris.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Sun-bleached hair and sand-scarred hands
npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of traveling beyond Obojima

npcs.name: Suki
npcs.description: Courier Brigade rider who specializes in dangerous routes. Fearless on her modified bicycle.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Goggles permanently pushed up on her forehead
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a cure for an ailment

npcs.name: Old Matsuda
npcs.description: Retired fisherman turned storyteller. Holds court at the harbor telling tales of sea spirits.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Missing two fingers on his left hand
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Pebble
npcs.description: Tiny stone spirit who works as a messenger between the spirit and human communities.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Body made of smooth river stones
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to prove their worth to a mentor

npcs.name: Haruto
npcs.description: Dockworker and amateur boxer. Dreams of opening a fighting gym.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Cauliflower ears and a broad grin
npcs.flavorWant: Desires to uncover a buried truth

npcs.name: Yumi
npcs.description: Seamstress who makes the traditional festival kimonos. Her work is in high demand.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Thimbles on every finger
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to befriend a spirit

npcs.name: Ren
npcs.description: Night watchman who patrols the old quarter. Has seen things he won't talk about.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A lantern that never goes out
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to reunite with a lost companion

npcs.name: Chizuru
npcs.description: Tea house owner who serves as an informal mediator for disputes in the merchant quarter.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Elaborate silver hair pins
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks the perfect mushroom specimen

npcs.name: Fumio
npcs.description: Street sweeper who knows every alley and secret passage in Yatamon.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A broom taller than he is
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks spiritual enlightenment

npcs.name: Riko
npcs.description: Paper lantern spirit who lights up the evening markets. Shy but helpful.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Body that glows warmly from within
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Jinbei
npcs.description: Harbor master who manages ship traffic and collects docking fees. Gruff but honest.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Enormous salt-and-pepper mustache
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to find a lost family heirloom

npcs.name: Duro
npcs.description: Master blacksmith of Toggle. Duro forges weapons and tools from rare alloys found in the mountain mines.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Arms covered in burn scars he wears proudly
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to protect someone dear to them

npcs.name: Garo
npcs.description: Duro's apprentice and younger brother. Specializes in delicate metalwork and mechanical components.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Always wearing thick leather gloves
npcs.flavorWant: Desires to uncover a buried truth

npcs.name: Holly Clintock
npcs.description: Brilliant engineer who designs and maintains Toggle's wind-powered machinery. Sister to Paloma in Polewater.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Grease smudge permanently on her left cheek
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Captain Clintock
npcs.description: Retired sea captain and patriarch of the Clintock family. Now serves as Toggle's informal leader and mediator.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Pegleg carved from ironwood
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to protect someone dear to them

npcs.name: Marcel
npcs.description: Lighthouse keeper at Toggle Point. Marcel maintains the beacon that guides ships through the rocky approach.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: One eye perpetually squinting from years of watching the light
npcs.flavorWant: Dreams of traveling beyond Obojima

npcs.name: Shinobu
npcs.description: Mountain herbalist who gathers medicinal plants from the high slopes above Toggle.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A basket that seems bottomless
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a cure for an ailment

npcs.name: Gravel
npcs.description: Rock spirit who works the mines. Knows every vein and fault line in the mountain.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Body of living granite
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Pip
npcs.description: Young runner who carries messages between Toggle and the lowland settlements.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Perpetually out of breath
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to settle an old score

npcs.name: Esma
npcs.description: Cook who runs Toggle's communal kitchen. Her mountain stew is the town's pride.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A ladle she wields like a weapon
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to reunite with a lost companion

npcs.name: Thorn
npcs.description: Reclusive prospector who trades rare minerals for supplies. Distrustful of outsiders.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Crystals growing from his shoulders
npcs.flavorWant: Wants revenge on someone who wronged them

npcs.name: Windy
npcs.description: Air spirit who helps power the windmills. Mischievous and unpredictable.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Hair of streaming wind that never settles
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to reunite with a lost companion

npcs.name: Vorian
npcs.description: Elven sand sculptor who creates breathtaking temporary art on Tidewater's beaches. His works vanish with each tide.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Sand permanently embedded in the lines of his palms
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to reunite with a lost companion

npcs.name: Ulmat
npcs.description: Omenspeaker who reads the future in tide pools and wave patterns. Tidewater's spiritual guide.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Antlers wrapped in dried kelp
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks spiritual enlightenment

npcs.name: Gritty Groff
npcs.description: The 'Sand Witch' of Tidewater. Makes sandwiches and sand-based potions with equal enthusiasm.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Gritty laugh and sand in her teeth
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Great Ferek
npcs.description: Massive sculptor who works in coral and driftwood. Competitive rival to Vorian's sand art.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Hands the size of dinner plates
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Kersh
npcs.description: Child warlock beachcomber who found a patron in a tide pool creature. Collects strange shells that whisper.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Pockets always full of whispering shells
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to befriend a spirit

npcs.name: Marisol
npcs.description: Net mender who also repairs sails and rigging. Strong and quiet.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Fingers calloused into permanent curves
npcs.flavorWant: Wants revenge on someone who wronged them

npcs.name: Cove
npcs.description: Tide spirit who warns fishers of dangerous currents. Appears as a shimmering figure in the surf.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Body of swirling saltwater
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to prove their worth to a mentor

npcs.name: Tomoko
npcs.description: Diver who harvests pearls and abalone from the reef. Best free-diver in Tidewater.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Lungs like bellows, can hold breath for minutes
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to protect someone dear to them

npcs.name: Reef
npcs.description: Fisherman who claims to speak with the fish. Nobody is sure if he's serious.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Scale-like birthmarks on his neck
npcs.flavorWant: Wants revenge on someone who wronged them

npcs.name: Sunny
npcs.description: Cheerful bait seller and gossip who sets up shop at dawn every day.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Sunburn that never fades
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to settle an old score

npcs.name: Anchor
npcs.description: Retired sailor who runs a beachside shack selling grilled fish and stories.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A real anchor tattooed on his chest
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a cure for an ailment

npcs.name: Little Yoshi
npcs.description: Boat builder's apprentice who dreams of sailing to the mainland.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Sawdust permanently in his hair
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Coral
npcs.description: Reef spirit who tends the living coral gardens offshore. Concerned about the Corruption reaching the reef.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Body of branching pink coral
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to prove their worth to a mentor

npcs.name: Adira
npcs.description: Head healer of Hogstone Hot Springs. Adira's poultices and thermal treatments can mend wounds both physical and spiritual.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Warm hands that glow faintly when healing
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to protect someone dear to them

npcs.name: Chisuay
npcs.description: Tea master who brews with spring water and rare mountain herbs. Secretly an oni who genuinely loves tea more than mischief.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Steam curls from his nostrils when he laughs
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to build something lasting

npcs.name: Migo
npcs.description: Chisuay's cheerful assistant who tends the tea garden. A small hot-spring spirit who loves chatting with visitors.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Body perpetually steaming like a hot kettle
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to find a lost family heirloom

npcs.name: Indigo
npcs.description: A fossa-shaped spirit who serves as majordomo of the hot springs resort. Impeccably organized and slightly haughty.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Sleek dark fur and an impossibly long tail
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to protect someone dear to them

npcs.name: Yuki
npcs.description: Masseuse whose treatments are said to cure everything from broken hearts to cursed limbs.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Hands that crack like thunder
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to find a lost family heirloom

npcs.name: Banto
npcs.description: Groundskeeper who maintains the pools and channels. Knows the plumbing of the springs intimately.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Perpetually damp clothing
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to build something lasting

npcs.name: Suzu
npcs.description: Bell spirit who announces guests and rings the hour. Her chimes carry across the valley.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Body shaped like a bronze bell
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a cure for an ailment

npcs.name: Hotaru
npcs.description: Night attendant who tends the lanterns and watches over guests during evening soaks.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Eyes that reflect light like a cat's
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Kemushi
npcs.description: Gardener who cultivates the medicinal herb gardens surrounding the springs.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Green-tinged skin from years among plants
npcs.flavorWant: Desires recognition from the community

npcs.name: Rindo
npcs.description: Cook who prepares the healing broths and therapeutic meals for guests.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A nose that can identify any herb by smell alone
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks spiritual enlightenment

npcs.name: Okami
npcs.description: Wolf spirit who guards the mountain paths to Hogstone. Fiercely territorial but respects those who show proper courtesy.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Silver-white fur that shimmers in moonlight
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks the perfect mushroom specimen

npcs.name: Voraro the Parasite
npcs.description: A warlock who has bonded with a parasitic entity found deep in the Shoom. Voraro lurks in the dungeon, drawing power from the corruption.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Black veins visible beneath translucent skin
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to build something lasting

npcs.name: Lionfish King
npcs.description: Ruler of the Coral Throne in the undersea dungeon. A massive lionfish spirit who commands the fish folk armies.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Crown of living venomous spines
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks spiritual enlightenment

npcs.name: Ranger Kesso
npcs.description: AHA ranger who went missing during a patrol near the Shoom. Captured and held in the depths.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Torn AHA uniform with ranger insignia
npcs.flavorWant: Desires peace and quiet above all else

npcs.name: Courier Fane
npcs.description: Courier Brigade rider who disappeared while carrying a message through the Gale Fields.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Courier satchel with undelivered letters
npcs.flavorWant: Seeks a cure for an ailment

npcs.name: Traveling Sora
npcs.description: Wandering merchant who trades between settlements, carrying rare goods and rarer news.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A cart pulled by a trained boar
npcs.flavorWant: Wants to settle an old score

npcs.name: Ranger Aoki
npcs.description: AHA ranger who patrols the northern routes. Reports to the AHA leadership in Yatamon.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: A bow made of pale driftwood
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to master a new craft

npcs.name: Courier Miku
npcs.description: Courier Brigade rider who handles the mountain routes between Toggle and Hogstone.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Bicycle with oversized wheels for mountain terrain
npcs.flavorWant: Craves a specific rare tea

npcs.name: Wandering Gust
npcs.description: A wind spirit who drifts between settlements carrying whispered messages from the spirit world.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Translucent body that ripples like a heat mirage
npcs.flavorWant: Hopes to master a new craft

factions.name: Fish Head Coven
factions.description: The most powerful witch coven on Obojima, controlling magical ingredient trade from the Gale Fields.

advantages.name: Magical ingredient monopoly
advantages.description: Controls rare ingredient trade across the island

advantages.name: Hidden domain in Gale Fields
advantages.description: Stronghold concealed in tall grass, warded by powerful magic

agenda.description: Expand control over ingredient sources in every region
Investigate the Corruption for arcane potential
Recruit promising young witches from across the island

obstacle.description: Competition for the same goal creates conflict

goals.description: Expand control over rare magical ingredients

symbols: A fish skull wreathed in seaweed
rumors: They brew potions that can control minds
The coven mother speaks to fish spirits

factions.name: Domain of the Lionfish King
factions.description: The Lionfish King rules fish folk warriors in the Shallows, growing paranoid since the Corruption's arrival.
factions.purpose: asserting dominion over the Shallows and coastal settlements

advantages.name: Fish folk army
advantages.description: Commands hundreds of fish folk warriors striking from the sea

advantages.name: The Shallows
advantages.description: Controls the reef surrounding Obojima

agenda.description: Destroy Captain Clintock and the Pointue
Raid Tidewater and claim the Pearl of Rongol
Drive back the Corruption threatening his domain

obstacle.description: A mighty foe stands in their way

goals.description: Destroy Captain Clintock and the Pointue

rumors: The Lionfish King can control the tides
His corruption spreads through the coral

factions.name: Mariners' Guild
factions.description: The seafaring guild controlling shipping and trade routes around Obojima. Based primarily in Tidewater.

advantages.name: Fleet of trading vessels
advantages.description: A dozen ships from fishing boats to cargo vessels

advantages.name: Navigational charts
advantages.description: Generations of accumulated knowledge of Obojima's waters

agenda.description: Expand trade routes to the outer islands
Map the dangerous waters of the Shallows
Drive out Lionfish King's forces from shipping lanes

obstacle.description: Lionfish King's forces threaten shipping lanes

goals.description: Expand trade routes to the outer islands

factions.name: Courier Brigade
factions.description: Swift messengers maintaining communication across Obojima's difficult terrain using trained flying creatures and athletic runners.

advantages.name: Network of relay stations
advantages.description: Rest points across every region of Obojima

advantages.name: Trained messenger animals
advantages.description: Birds and small creatures trained to carry messages

agenda.description: Establish a relay station on Mount Arbora's peak
Breed faster messenger birds
Secure routes through the Gale Fields

obstacle.description: Gale Fields storms frequently ground their messengers

goals.description: Establish a relay station on Mount Arbora's peak

factions.name: AHA (Archaeologists, Historians & Archivists)
factions.description: A well-meaning organization that coordinates adventuring parties and ensures ethical guidelines. Based in Yatamon, providing contracts, mediation, and rescue services.

advantages.name: Adventurer registry
advantages.description: Comprehensive records of active adventuring parties

advantages.name: Rescue teams
advantages.description: Trained groups ready to extract failed expeditions

agenda.description: Establish an adventurer code of conduct across Obojima
Build a proper headquarters in Yatamon
Create a comprehensive map of Obojima's dungeons

obstacle.description: Many adventurers resist regulation and oversight

goals.description: Establish an adventurer code of conduct across Obojima

factions.name: Patchwork Robe Coven
factions.description: A coven of witches and hedge wizards practicing folk magic and herbal medicine. Generally helpful to common folk but suspicious of formal magical institutions.

advantages.name: Herbal knowledge
advantages.description: Vast knowledge of Obojima's medicinal plants

advantages.name: Folk trust
advantages.description: Common people trust them more than formal wizards

agenda.description: Protect sacred groves from exploitation
Preserve ancient herbal knowledge
Counter Cloud Cap Coven's magical regulations

obstacle.description: Cloud Cap Coven considers them reckless amateurs

factions.name: Cloud Cap Coven
factions.description: An elite circle of powerful spellcasters studying arcane winds atop Mount Arbora. They consider themselves the true magical authority of Obojima.

advantages.name: Arcane library
advantages.description: Vast collection of magical texts and scrolls

advantages.name: Mountain fortress
advantages.description: Nearly impregnable tower atop Mount Arbora

agenda.description: Harness the arcane storms of the Gale Fields
Establish magical regulation across Obojima
Uncover the source of the Brackwater corruption

obstacle.description: The storms they study are growing more unpredictable

goals.description: Harness the arcane storms of the Gale Fields

factions.name: The Crowsworn
factions.description: A secretive order of rangers and scouts patrolling the wilds of Obojima, protecting travelers and monitoring threats. Named for the crows they use as scouts.

advantages.name: Wilderness expertise
advantages.description: Unmatched knowledge of Obojima's wild places

advantages.name: Crow network
advantages.description: Trained crows serving as scouts and early warning system

agenda.description: Map and contain the corruption spreading from Brackwater
Establish a permanent watch post near Corrupted Coastline
Train new rangers to replace aging members

obstacle.description: The corruption is spreading faster than they can contain it

goals.description: Map and contain the corruption spreading from Brackwater

factions.name: League of the Gilded Gourd
factions.description: A merchant consortium controlling much of the inland trade on Obojima. They prize profit above all and are known for shrewd business practices.

advantages.name: Trade caravans
advantages.description: Well-guarded merchant caravans connecting inland settlements

advantages.name: Wealth reserves
advantages.description: Significant gold reserves and credit networks

agenda.description: Monopolize the hot springs mineral trade
Establish exclusive trade agreements with all settlements
Undercut the Mariners' Guild's influence in Tidewater

obstacle.description: Mariners' Guild controls the more lucrative sea trade

goals.description: Monopolize the hot springs mineral trade

factions.name: The Tall Hats
factions.description: A mysterious cabal of judges and arbiters settling disputes across Obojima. They wear distinctive tall hats and are respected and feared for their impartial but severe judgments.

advantages.name: Legal authority
advantages.description: Widely recognized right to arbitrate disputes

advantages.name: Information network
advantages.description: Extensive records of contracts, crimes, and disputes

agenda.description: Codify a unified law for all of Obojima
Investigate corruption in Yatamon's governance
Extend judicial authority to the frontier settlements

obstacle.description: Settlements resist giving up their local legal autonomy

goals.description: Codify a unified law for all of Obojima

factions.name: Society of Young Stewards
factions.description: An idealistic organization of young leaders training to govern and protect Obojima. They believe in civic duty and work to improve infrastructure and public services.

advantages.name: Youthful energy
advantages.description: Dedicated young members willing to work hard

advantages.name: Popular support
advantages.description: Common folk appreciate their public works projects

agenda.description: Build a bridge connecting Okiri to the northern road
Establish a public school in every settlement
Create a disaster response system for storms and floods

obstacle.description: Older factions see them as naive and resist their reforms

goals.description: Build a bridge connecting Okiri to the northern road

factions.name: The Four Sword Schools
factions.description: Four competing martial arts academies teaching different combat styles. While rivals, they share a common code of honor and occasionally unite against external threats.

advantages.name: Martial expertise
advantages.description: The finest warriors on Obojima

advantages.name: Training grounds
advantages.description: Well-equipped dojos and training facilities

agenda.description: Host the Grand Tournament to prove the supreme style
Train warriors to defend against the growing corruption
Establish a warrior code all schools can agree on

obstacle.description: Internal rivalry prevents unified action against real threats

goals.description: Host the Grand Tournament to prove the supreme style

significantItems.name: The Pearl of Rongol
significantItems.description: An enormous pearl glowing with inner light, housed in the Tower of Glass in Tidewater
significantItems.effect: Grants visions of coming events; may be calling to something in the deep ocean
significantItems.history: Pulled from the sea by diver Rongol. Lightning struck the sand, creating the Tower of Glass.
significantItems.significance: A beacon calling to an unknown power in the ocean depths

significantItems.name: Chisuay's Heavenly Tea
significantItems.description: A beautifully wrapped package of fragrant tea, each blend unique
significantItems.history: Perfected by tea master Chisuay over decades in his mountaintop teahouse.
significantItems.significance: Known across all of Obojima as the finest tea

significantItems.name: The Pointue's Horn
significantItems.description: The swordfish-shaped prow of Captain Clintock's submarine
significantItems.effect: Can pierce magical barriers and stretch through narrow passages
significantItems.history: Designed by Holly Clintock and enchanted by the Mariners' Guild.
significantItems.significance: The key component of the most advanced submersible on Obojima

significantItems.name: Happy Joy Cake
significantItems.description: A delicious pastry made with love and First Age magic by Master Hu
significantItems.effect: Grants 1d4 temp HP and advantage on CHA checks for 1 hour
significantItems.history: Perfected over 50 years at the Happy Joy Cake Bakery in Yatamon.

hooks.rumor: A midwife from Polewater went into the Shoom to gather herbs and hasn't returned for three days
hooks.truth: The midwife stumbled into Voraro's territory and is being held captive, her life force slowly drained

hooks.rumor: A pearl diver was captured by fish folk near the Coral Throne
hooks.truth: The Lionfish King is holding the diver as a bargaining chip to negotiate with surface dwellers

hooks.rumor: A Courier Brigade rider never arrived at Toggle with an urgent message
hooks.truth: The courier was swept off the mountain path by corrupted winds and is trapped in a cave

hooks.rumor: A child from Okiri wandered into the Crawling Canopy chasing a glowing butterfly
hooks.truth: The child found a First Age chamber and is protected by ancient guardians but cannot leave

hooks.rumor: An AHA ranger went to investigate strange lights in the wetlands and hasn't reported back
hooks.truth: Ranger Kesso is imprisoned in the Shoom by Voraro, who uses him as bait for more captives

hooks.rumor: A tea merchant disappeared on the road between Hogstone and Yatamon
hooks.truth: Bandits ambushed the merchant and are holding them in a mountain hideout for ransom

hooks.rumor: Granny Yuzu's apprentice went to retrieve an artifact from beneath the city and hasn't returned
hooks.truth: The apprentice activated a First Age defense system in the subway tunnels

hooks.rumor: A spirit fisherman from Uluwa vanished while fishing in deep waters
hooks.truth: The fisherman discovered an underwater passage and is trapped by a collapsed entrance

hooks.rumor: Someone needs to transport a crate of Pointue mushrooms past fish folk territory to Tidewater
hooks.truth: The mushrooms are actually a cover for smuggling a First Age power cell that Humble Utzu wants

hooks.rumor: The mushroom harvest from Matango needs armed escort to the Yatamon market
hooks.truth: Chogo's gang plans to hijack the shipment and sell it on the black market

hooks.rumor: The AHA needs guides for an expedition into the corrupted southern marshes
hooks.truth: The AHA suspects the corruption has a central source they want to locate and study

hooks.rumor: A nervous scholar needs bodyguards to reach the Coral Throne for research
hooks.truth: Dr. Frond believes the Coral Throne holds proof that the Corruption is artificial

hooks.rumor: Captain Clintock needs a crew to escort a shipment of alloys down from Toggle to the coast
hooks.truth: The alloys are needed to repair ancient machinery that Holly discovered

hooks.rumor: A delegation from Uluwa needs protection traveling to Yatamon for trade negotiations
hooks.truth: The delegation carries a spirit artifact that certain humans would kill to possess

hooks.rumor: Mama Amala needs someone to escort her to a remote shrine in the mountains
hooks.truth: The shrine contains a sealed evil that Mama Amala must re-bind before the next full moon

hooks.rumor: A wounded AHA ranger needs safe passage from the Gale Fields back to Yatamon
hooks.truth: The ranger carries intelligence about a new corruption outbreak that enemies want suppressed

hooks.rumor: The legendary Moonpearl has been stolen from Tidewater's shrine
hooks.truth: Mr. Basingstoke orchestrated the theft to use the pearl in a ritual for his patron

hooks.rumor: The Corruption is spreading faster than natural, someone might be feeding it
hooks.truth: Voraro the Parasite is channeling energy from captured victims to accelerate the corruption

hooks.rumor: Vorian's masterwork sand sculpture was sabotaged the night before the festival
hooks.truth: Great Ferek's apprentice did it out of jealousy, but Ferek himself is horrified

hooks.rumor: Three different cooks in Yatamon have reported their secret ingredients going missing
hooks.truth: A mischievous spirit is collecting the ingredients to recreate a legendary First Age dish

hooks.rumor: People near the hot springs are having identical strange visions of a burning city
hooks.truth: The springs are channeling memories from a First Age catastrophe sealed beneath Hogstone

hooks.rumor: Ships are disappearing near the coast with no wreckage found
hooks.truth: The Lionfish King's forces are capturing ships and dragging them to an underwater base

hooks.rumor: Someone has been leaving strange glowing symbols on buildings in Yatamon at night
hooks.truth: Mikiko is sleepwalking and casting spells unconsciously, channeling First Age magic

hooks.rumor: The mycelium network in Matango has stopped growing, and mushrooms are dying
hooks.truth: A buried First Age device is emitting energy that poisons the fungal network

hooks.rumor: Travelers between Okiri and Polewater report hearing singing from empty fields
hooks.truth: A trapped spirit in an old well is calling for help, growing weaker each day

hooks.rumor: Gomber has been hired to investigate why the trolley keeps breaking down at the same spot
hooks.truth: A First Age subway station beneath the tracks is interfering with surface mechanisms

hooks.rumor: Rokoko needs a specific bioluminescent mushroom that only grows in the deep caves near Toggle
hooks.truth: The mushroom is actually a symbiotic organism with a cave spirit who must be negotiated with

hooks.rumor: Holly Clintock needs a special alloy from the deep mines of Toggle for a critical repair
hooks.truth: The alloy vein is in territory claimed by a territorial rock spirit

hooks.rumor: Someone is willing to pay handsomely for Laughing Moss from the Crawling Canopy
hooks.truth: The moss is needed for an antidote to a rare poison that is slowly killing a village elder

hooks.rumor: Orble the Fisher needs someone to catch a spirit fish from the deepest pool in Uluwa
hooks.truth: The spirit fish contains a message from an ancient water spirit about coming danger

hooks.rumor: Chisuay needs a specific mineral spring water from a cave guarded by corrupted creatures
hooks.truth: The water is the only thing that can suppress his oni nature during the solstice

hooks.rumor: Dr. Frond needs coral samples from the reef that only grows near the Corrupted Coastline
hooks.truth: The coral contains traces of First Age bio-engineering that could explain the Corruption

hooks.rumor: Master Hu's legendary recipe requires honey from spirit bees in the Gale Fields
hooks.truth: The spirit bees are dying and their hive is the last one, making this a conservation mission too

hooks.rumor: Madame Porcini needs a rare truffle that only grows in the ruins beneath Matango
hooks.truth: The truffle is growing on a First Age power conduit and removing it may have consequences

hooks.rumor: A blacksmith in Toggle needs fire-iron ore from a volcanic vent near the coast
hooks.truth: The volcanic vent is actually a slumbering fire spirit who trades ore for offerings

hooks.rumor: Fishermen have spotted structures beneath the waves off Tidewater's coast
hooks.truth: An entire First Age underwater facility lies beneath the reef, still partially powered

hooks.rumor: The AHA wants a detailed map of the Crawling Canopy's interior
hooks.truth: Previous mapping expeditions have all returned with incomplete and contradictory maps

hooks.rumor: The Corrupted Coastline has shifted, revealing cave entrances that weren't there before
hooks.truth: The corruption is eroding barriers to a First Age weapons vault

hooks.rumor: Cholly claims there are abandoned subway tunnels beneath Yatamon from the First Age
hooks.truth: The tunnels connect to a vast underground network that spans much of the island

hooks.rumor: A new hot spring has erupted near Hogstone, but the water is an unnatural color
hooks.truth: The spring breached a First Age containment chamber, and something is leaking out

hooks.rumor: Spirit paths in the wetlands have shifted, opening routes to previously unreachable areas
hooks.truth: The shift was caused by a spiritual earthquake and the new paths are unstable

hooks.rumor: An old map found in Granny Yuzu's collection shows a tower that doesn't appear on modern maps
hooks.truth: The tower is cloaked by spirit magic and can only be seen during certain moon phases

hooks.rumor: Miners in Toggle broke through to an enormous cavern filled with First Age machinery
hooks.truth: The machinery is still functional and appears to be a weather control system

hooks.rumor: A fish folk messenger has appeared at Tidewater asking to speak with human leaders
hooks.truth: A faction of fish folk wants to defect from the Lionfish King and seek asylum on land

hooks.rumor: Two mushroom clans in Matango are on the verge of war over truffle territory
hooks.truth: Both clans are being manipulated by Chogo who profits from the conflict

hooks.rumor: The Lionfish King has sent an emissary demanding tribute from coastal settlements
hooks.truth: The King is actually testing surface-dweller resolve before a major offensive

hooks.rumor: A coven of witches near Okiri wants to negotiate a mutual defense pact with the village
hooks.truth: The coven has been secretly protecting Okiri from corruption and wants recognition

hooks.rumor: The spirits of Uluwa are considering closing their market to non-spirits
hooks.truth: Recent disrespectful behavior by human traders has deeply offended the spirit community

hooks.rumor: The AHA and the Courier Brigade disagree about who should control the mountain passes
hooks.truth: Both organizations are needed and a compromise would benefit everyone

hooks.rumor: A powerful spirit in the Gale Fields is demanding offerings to let travelers pass
hooks.truth: The spirit is actually scared and defensive because corruption is approaching its territory

hooks.rumor: Toggle and Tidewater are in a trade dispute over mineral rights
hooks.truth: A third party is forging trade documents to create conflict and profit from both sides

hooks.truth: The midwife stumbled into Voraro's territory and is being held captive, her life force slowly drained

clocks.name: Fish Head Coven: Ingredient Monopoly
clocks.description: The Fish Head Coven is consolidating control over rare magical ingredients

consequences.description: The coven controls all rare ingredient trade

clocks.name: Lionfish King: Coastal Raids
clocks.description: The Lionfish King is escalating raids on coastal settlements

consequences.description: Coastal villages cut off from sea trade

clocks.name: Pointue Lighthouse Repair
clocks.description: The Mariners' Guild works to repair the damaged Pointue lighthouse, crucial for safe navigation around Obojima's reefs.

consequences.description: Safe navigation restored around the island
Mariners' Guild gains major influence in Toggle

clocks.name: Courier Route Through Canopy
clocks.description: The Courier Brigade attempts to establish a reliable route through the Crawling Canopy, connecting isolated communities.

clocks.name: AHA Undercity Excavation
clocks.description: AHA archaeologists dig deeper into pre-human ruins beneath the island, risking unleashing something ancient.

clocks.name: Corruption Spreading Westward
clocks.description: The corruption creeps further from the eastern coastline, threatening more settlements and wildlife.

clocks.name: Patchwork Robe Coven's Ambition
clocks.description: Patchwork Robe Coven is working to protect sacred groves from exploitation

consequences.description: Patchwork Robe Coven advances its agenda significantly

clocks.name: Cloud Cap Coven's Ambition
clocks.description: Cloud Cap Coven is working to harness the arcane storms of the gale fields

consequences.description: Cloud Cap Coven advances its agenda significantly

clocks.description: The Crowsworn is working to map and contain the corruption spreading from brackwater

consequences.description: The Crowsworn advances its agenda significantly

clocks.description: League of the Gilded Gourd is working to monopolize the hot springs mineral trade

consequences.description: League of the Gilded Gourd advances its agenda significantly

clocks.description: The Tall Hats is working to codify a unified law for all of obojima

consequences.description: The Tall Hats advances its agenda significantly

consequences.description: Society of Young Stewards advances its agenda significantly

consequences.description: The Four Sword Schools advances its agenda significantly
